author: Pascal
title: Global Impact: Fighting COVID

assessments.note:
There are some use cases in which blockchains are being useful to help combat COVID, I believe that in the areas of supply chains, logistics and decentralized identity are good examples and Cardano already has some associated projects in these areas, however if this challenge is approved and chosen by the community it would take a few months for any proposal coming from it to materialize and probably this would only happen at the end of the year. This raises some doubts about the impact of the challenge, as the scenario in so many months is uncertain.

I believe that Cardano will be a good option to be used as a supply chain structure in distribution networks for medicines, vaccines, but I am not sure about the impact of this in relation to COVID, due to the uncertain time horizon of the duration of this crisis.

By the time we are done with Fund 6, COVID-19 is (hopefully) yesterday's news. Therefore, this could be broadened to either:
- How might we use Cardano to mitigate the risks related to communicable diseases? OR
- How might we enable the community to react quickly to pressing global issues (like COVID-19) as and when they emerge?

This challenge is not critical to the blockchain, yet it is for its community's members.
I can see the way of thinking that if Cardano solves at least a portion of the issues presented here, that this would be good publicity and could be adopted in a long lasting legacy.
I can only advise to think of what to do with this after COVID by making an addition in the challenge brief of how you could reuse this.
Although Cardano is amining to expand globally, the Covid issue is beyond Cardano direct scope
The relationship between cardano and covid is not clear on what can be done. What is a 'covid cardano project'?

Although there are wide number of potential use of the technology. Covid related applications are trivial in regards of integration and usability. A decentralized platform could not be the best way to monitor and organized a centralized challenge that requires missive oversight, control and identity to be disclosed and shared for feasible opportunities.
I dont think this is critical to achieve cardanos current mission

In principle I agree, that ‚supportive technology for dealing with pandemic crises' would be an interesting Challenge Setting. I would not limit this to COVID-19. This can definitely demonstrate the potential of CARDANO's technology to a wider public and act as frame for very interesting proposals.

The proposal fails to define a problem much less a solution that's in line with Cardano's goals. The mere mention of Cardano's decentralised nature and the obvious problem of the global pandemic, be it covid or whatever else, is insufficient. There may well be value in utilising Cardano's capabilities to assist in the global efforts to combat, manage and/or track the current pandemic but this proposal is not nuanced enough to clearly paint the picture of what it is trying to achieve.
we need specialists people to achieve this task

Based on the assumption that we will have the full version of Goguen in about 3 months, I believe that it is technically feasible to use Cardano for various niches that are being affected by COVID (suppy chains, logistics, decentralized identity, among others), however we we don't know how long the COVID crisis will last and any proposal resulting from this challenge will take many months to be implemented, with some blockchains already available for such needs now.
Surely the community would come with a lot of solutions for this theme.

You will need a team to develop these solutions on this scale. You would need team members with medical expertise, which I believe will be quite hard to find. Yet if you do, it would greatly improve your proposal.

It's not clear how the community can help by implementing a covid related project. Is it by tracking vaccinated people living around community members ? Is it by tracking community members who got covid ?
More details are required here to know what is feasible or not. At this moment I'm not seeing any actionable ideas.
I think it falls well away from the community expertise and scope of ability. Perhaps in a decade the infrastructure could be there to deploy any sensible application.

I think that it is too early to enter such a 'emotionally and politically super-charged stage'. I suggest that the community is better off in focusing on finalizing important foundational applications (such as DID, personal health data on blockchain, etc.) before immaturely entering this 'application mine-field'.

There is a certain level of merit that could be given this proposal given it has provided metrics by which this Challenge Setting's success can be measured. However details on how it will progress is lacking. There is no doubt that such a challenge could focus Catalyst to solve problems in this space but the generalised proposal is in the early stages and more details need to be teased out.
this is too hard to attract capable people to sort the trusthfull information , as i see it we will attract "complotist, anti vacs and so...

I believe that the metrics presented are reasonable, but the problem of COVID's time horizon and the duration of the crisis can compromise the relevance of these metrics.

Let's say that vaccines are effective and the crisis is controlled in the next 6 months. Would the established metrics have the same relevance? I believe that would be less risky to establish challenges related to drug supply chains/vaccines(example), in a way unconnected to COVID, so that the success of the challenge is not totally dependent on it.
Number of articles, projects and transfers might not be measuring the right things. How about number of lives saved or percentage of community involved etc?

It was unclear to me what you mean with 'used in real world products'.
As this proposal implies a huge project, I suggest setting up a roadmap and clear milestones to further assess success.
Furthermore, I must pose a questionmark with the 100000 USD asked. It would be nice to see a detail of prospected costs instead of just a number.
One of the KPIs is encouraging of open up more project requests but not directly measuring the success of the challenge proposed.
There are metrics which are good but there isn't a basis on how to achieve them. More information is critical on how to accomplish.

The metrics fail to explain how it can be used in the blockchain or the technology and solution used for real life application. Perhaps more clarity in to how ca the proposal achieve meaningful results towards that goal.
You failed to explain why a blockchain solution is needed to fight COVID in my opinion

Yes, application projects can be created and media articles can be counted. BUT: CARDANO's reputation can be VERY easily damaged when entering such a 'slippery stage'. The journey to success is VERY long and has mostly non-technical (political and legal) hurdles to take. I see this as a very interesting field in the long run, but not at this early stage of the Cardano project. I strongly suggest to refrain from such an experiment for now, in my view way too risky from 'brand reputation' perspective.

Metrics by which this Challenge Setting can be assessed have been provided. However, they are at a general level that specifics are needed. We have all lived through this pandemic and most have been familiar with the levels of specificity of certain databases like the dataset provided by the John Hopkins School of Medicin, that even laypersons now poses a high level of expectation in terms of Covid19.
we have 99% of chance to fail and become rise of jokes

importance:
* Help solving a top priority global problem.
* Demonstrate Cardano's utility
success: Solutions built on / integrating Cardano are used in real world products to deal with COVID.
